paragraphs.zh-tw: I had a fire nine days ago. My archive: 175 films, my 16-millimeter negative, all my books, my dad's books, my photographs. I'd collected -- I was a collector, major, big-time.
paragraphs.en: 九天前我經歷了一場火災 我的存檔 175部電影 我的16釐米底片 所有我的藏書以及我爸的藏書 我所收藏的 我是個收藏家 重要的 一流的

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's gone. I just looked at it, and I didn't know what to do.
paragraphs.en: 通通都沒了 我就只是看著一切發生 我不知道要做什麼

paragraphs.zh-tw: I mean, this was -- was I my things? I always live in the present -- I love the present. I cherish the future.
paragraphs.en: 我是指 這個是 我的東西嗎??? 我總是活在當下--我喜歡當下 我珍惜未來

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I was taught some strange thing as a kid, like, you've got to make something good out of something bad. You've got to make something good out of something bad.
paragraphs.en: 我小時候被教了一些奇怪的觀念 像是：你必須從壞事中，創造出好的事情 你必須從壞事之中，創造好的事情

paragraphs.zh-tw: This was bad! Man, I was -- I cough. I was sick. That's my camera lens. The first one -- the one I shot my Bob Dylan film with 35 years ago.
paragraphs.en: 這真是壞事! 唉~ 我-- 我咳嗽 我生病了 那是我的相機鏡頭 我的第一個鏡頭 三十五年前我拍攝鮑伯迪倫的那個鏡頭

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's my feature film. "King, Murray" won Cannes Film Festival 1970 -- the only print I had. That's my papers.
paragraphs.en: 這是我執導的電影King, Murray 在1970年贏得坎城電影獎座 我僅有的拷貝 這是我的文件

paragraphs.zh-tw: That was in minutes -- 20 minutes. Epiphany hit me. Something hit me.
paragraphs.en: 就在短短幾分鐘之內 -- 20分鐘 靈光乍現，這念頭突然出現

paragraphs.zh-tw: "You've got to make something good out of something bad," I started to say to my friends, neighbors, my sister. By the way, that's "Sputnik." I ran it last year.
paragraphs.en: "你要從壞事中，創造出好的事情" 我開始跟朋友、鄰居、姐姐說 還有，這是"人造衛星" 我去年做的

paragraphs.zh-tw: "Sputnik" was downtown, the negative. It wasn't touched. These are some pieces of things I used in my Sputnik feature film, which opens in New York in two weeks downtown.
paragraphs.en: 人造衛星的底片放在市區，沒有被波及 這些是一些我用在人造衛星影片中的東西 電影二個禮拜內會在紐約上映 在市區

paragraphs.zh-tw: I called my sister. I called my neighbors. I said, "Come dig." That's me at my desk. That was a desk took 40-some years to build.
paragraphs.en: 我打電話給我的姐姐、我的鄰居。我說："過來一起挖吧!" 那是我在書桌旁 這張書桌花了四十幾年才作好的

paragraphs.zh-tw: You know -- all the stuff. That's my daughter, Jean.
paragraphs.en: 你知道的 所有的東西 這是我的女兒 Jean

paragraphs.zh-tw: She came. She's a nurse in San Francisco. "Dig it up," I said. "Pieces.
paragraphs.en: 她在舊金山當護士，也過來了 "開挖吧!" 我說："不要放過任何碎片，

paragraphs.zh-tw: I want pieces. Bits and pieces." I came up with this idea: a life of bits and pieces, which I'm just starting to work on -- my next project. That's my sister. She took care of pictures, because I was a big collector of snapshot photography that I believed said a lot.
paragraphs.en: "我要這些碎片" 我想到一個點子：生命的浮光片羽 這就是我正著手進行的下一個計畫 這是我的姐姐。她在整理照片。 因為我是個即興攝影的大收藏家 我相信數量很多

paragraphs.zh-tw: And those are some of the pictures that -- something was good about the burnt pictures. I didn't know. I looked at that -- I said, "Wow, is that better than the --" That's my proposal on Jimmy Doolittle. I made that movie for television.
paragraphs.en: 這些是部分的照片 燒焦的照片有個好處 我以前不知道的。我看著這張 -- 我說"哇 這樣好多了~" 這是我關於Jimmy Doolittle的提案 我為電視台拍的影片

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's the only copy I had. Pieces of it. Idea about women.
paragraphs.en: 這是我唯一擁有的版本 -- 部分殘骸 有關女人的創作

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I started to say, "Hey, man, you are too much! You could cry about this." I really didn't. I just instead said, "I'm going to make something out of it, and maybe next year ... " And I appreciate this moment to come up on this stage with so many people who've already given me so much solace, and just say to TEDsters: I'm proud of me. That I take something bad, I turn it, and I'm going to make something good out of this, all these pieces.
paragraphs.en: 因此我開始說 " 嘿~, 你太超過囉~" 你可以哭喊,"我真的沒有..." 我卻會說 我要去完成某件事情，也許在明年 同時，我感謝此時此刻 能夠上台，遇到許多人 給了我許多安慰 而我只跟TED人說： 我以我自己為榮。我碰上了壞事 我扭轉它，並且我會從中創造出好事 從這些碎片中。

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's Arthur Leipzig's original photograph I loved. I was a big record collector -- the records didn't make it. Boy, I tell you, film burns. Film burns.
paragraphs.en: 這是我喜愛的Arthur Leipzig原版照片 我是個唱片大收藏家 這唱片並未倖免於難。唉，我跟你說， 底片燒了 底片燒了

paragraphs.zh-tw: I mean, this was 16-millimeter safety film. The negatives are gone.
paragraphs.en: 我是指 這是16厘米安全底片 負片不見了

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's my father's letter to me, telling me to marry the woman I first married when I was 20. That's my daughter and me.
paragraphs.en: 這是我爸寫的信，跟我說 娶個老婆吧~我第一次的婚姻在我20歲的時候 這是我女兒和我

paragraphs.zh-tw: She's still there. She's there this morning, actually. That's my house.
paragraphs.en: 她還在這裡 事實上 她今天早上就在這裡 這是我的房子

paragraphs.zh-tw: My family's living in the Hilton Hotel in Scotts Valley. That's my wife, Heidi, who didn't take it as well as I did.
paragraphs.en: 我家人現在住在史考特谷的希爾頓飯店 這是我的老婆 海蒂 沒有像我一樣接受這一切

paragraphs.zh-tw: My children, Davey and Henry. My son, Davey, in the hotel two nights ago.
paragraphs.en: 我的小孩 戴維和亨利 我的兒子戴維，攝於飯店，在兩天前的晚上

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, my message to you folks, from my three minutes, is that I appreciate the chance to share this with you. I will be back. I love being at TED. I came to live it, and I am living it.
paragraphs.en: 我要給諸位的訊息是： 在我的三分鐘裡，我感謝有這個機會 跟大家分。 我會回來的，我愛來TED這裡 我來過我的生活，而我現在就在過我的生活

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's my view from my window outside of Santa Cruz, in Bonny Doon, just 35 miles from here. Thank you everybody.
paragraphs.en: 這是在Bonny Doon從我的窗戶往外望Santa Cruz的景象 離這裡35哩遠 謝謝大家
